column2: CALIFORNIA DMV TEST
column4: California
column6: CA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column4: waterplaning.
column6: rideplaning.
column8: hydroplaning.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column6: A road crosses the main highway ahead.
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 3. This road sign:
column4: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column6: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column8: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.

column2: 4. Which of these statements is true about motorcycles:
column4: motorcycles should be followed at a 4 second following distance.
column6: motorcycles are small and can easily be seen by drivers.
column8: motorcycles may not share traffic lanes.

column2: 5. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.
column6: be ready to shift to lower gear.
column8: be ready to brake sharply and stop.

column2: 6. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a low place in the road.
column6: low clearance.
column8: a narrow bridge ahead.

column2: 7. You drive defensively when you:
column4: Keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards.
column6: Always put one car length between you and the car ahead.
column8: Look only at the car in front of you while driving.

column2: 8. Two sets of solid, double, yellow lines that are two or more feet apart:
column4: should be treated as a separate traffic lane.
column6: may be crossed to enter or exit a private driveway.
column8: may not be crossed for any reason.

column2: 9. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column4: red lights.
column6: red warning lights.
column8: yellow warning lights.

column2: 10. Your cell phone rings while you are driving and you do not have a hands-free device. You should:
column4: not answer the call.
column6: check the incoming number before answering the call.
column8: answer the call because if it's an important one.

column2: 11. What is the best advice for driving in the fog?
column4: Turn on your windshield wipers.
column6: DON’T. Consider postponing your trip until the fog clears.
column8: Drive slow.

column2: 12. You are driving on the freeway. The vehicle in front of you is a large truck. You should drive:
column4: No more than one car length behind the truck so the driver can see you.
column6: Closely behind the truck in bad weather because the driver can see farther ahead.
column8: Farther behind the truck than you would for a passenger vehicle.

column2: 13. When you park alongside a curb on a level street, the front and back wheels must be parallel and within __ inches of the curb.
14. This sign means:
column4: slower traffic must exit on the right.
column6: you should slow down and move to the right lane.
column8: stay in the right lane if you are driving slower than other traffic.

column2: 15. All passengers ___ years of age or older must wear seat belts.
column4: eight
column6: six
column8: ten

column2: 16. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Apply the parking brake slowly.
column6: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 17. You are driving in the far right lane of a four-lane freeway and notice thick broken white lines on the left side of your lane. You are driving in:
column4: a special lane for slow moving vehicles.
column6: an exit lane.
column8: the carpool lane and must merge into the next lane.

column2: 18. Blind spots are:
column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column6: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column8: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.

column2: 19. If you approach the top of a hill and you do not have a clear view of the road ahead, you should:
column4: pull over and wait for the conditions to improve.
column6: slow down so you can stop if necessary.
column8: use your high beam lights to be more visible.

column2: 20. Roads are most slippery:
column4: when it first starts to rain.
column6: just before it rains.
column8: when it stops raining.

column2: 21. A white-painted curb means:
column4: Loading zone for passengers or mail only.
column6: Loading zone for freight only.
column8: Loading zone for freight or passengers.

column2: 22. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
column4: must not yield to
column6: must interrupt
column8: must yield to

column2: 23. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
column4: of a reduction of lanes
column6: of two-way traffic
column8: that a divided highway ends

column2: 24. The left or “fast” lane is also called:
column4: Number 3 Lane.
column6: Number 1 Lane.
column8: Number 2 Lane.

column2: 25. The speed limit at an uncontrolled crossing is:
column4: 20 MPH
column6: 15 MPH
column8: 25 MPH

column2: 26. Road signs that direct drivers to services are:
column4: green and white.
column6: brown and white.
column8: blue and white.

column2: 27. You exit a freeway on a ramp that curves downhill. You should:
column4: wait until you have entered the curve to begin braking.
column6: slow to a safe speed before the curve.
column8: slow to the posted speed limit for the freeway.

column2: 28. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column6: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column8: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.

column2: 29. If you see a pedestrian using a guide dog or carrying a white cane:
column4: the pedestrian must yield the right-of-way.
column6: you must yield the right-of-way to them.
column8: sound your horn to warn them.

column2: 30. Which of the following is true about railroad crossings:
column4: Watch for vehicles that must stop before they cross train tracks.
column6: Wait until you can completely cross the tracks before proceeding.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 31. The white sign means:
column4: Railroad crossing is controlled - continue at your regular speed.
column6: Stop at the railroad tracks and wait for a signal before crossing.
column8: Look, listen, and prepare to stop at the crossing, if necessary.

column2: 32. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must turn into its left lane.
column6: must turn into its right lane.
column8: can not turn left.

column2: 33. You are on the freeway and traffic is merging into your lane. You should:
column4: Make room for the merging traffic, if possible.
column6: Assert your right-of-way by driving faster.
column8: Always slow down and maintain your position.

column2: 34. You are at a red traffic signal. The traffic light turns green, but there are still other vehicles in the intersection. You should:
column4: wait until the vehicles clear the intersection before entering.
column6: enter the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.
column8: move ahead only if you can go around the other vehicles safely.

column2: 35. When you enter traffic from a stop, you:
column4: need a large enough gap to get up to the speed of traffic.
column6: should drive slower than other traffic for 200 feet.
column8: should wait for the first vehicle to pass, then pull into the lane.

column2: 36. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Parallel railroad crossing (side road)
column6: Low ground clearance railroad crossing
column8: Parallel railroad crossing (crossroad)
